p: Copper ions are commonly included in cosmetics. Cu is used as an active component of face creams, including those for the care of mature, tired, dull or oily skin [ 118, 130]. The effectiveness of the active ingredients is known to depend on their ability to penetrate the skin [ 130, 131]. A study by Mazurowka and Mojski showed that the peptides glycyl-histydyl-lysine (GHK) and Î³-glutamyl-cysteinyl-glycine (GSH) influence the permeation of copper ions through the horny layer of the epidermis [ 131]. The copper tripeptide complex (GHK-Cu and GSH-Cu) plays an important role in the protection and regeneration of skin tissue, increases the synthesis of collagen and elastin, and improves the condition of ageing skin. For this reason, copper peptides are often used as cosmetic ingredients [ 130]. In comparison with other metal compounds, copper has a low allergenic potential, and the risk of adverse side effects due to skin contact with the metal is small [ 132, 133].
